isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Fuel and High-pressure Oil Systems - Periodic Service

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.
To prevent personal injury or death, shift transmission to park or neutral, set parking brake, and block wheels before doing diagnostic or service procedures.
To prevent personal injury or death, disconnect the main battery negative terminal before disconnecting or connecting electrical components.
To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

To prevent personal injury or death, do not let engine fluids stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails using hand cleaner and wash with soap and water. Wash or discard clothing and rags contaminated with engine fluids.
To prevent personal injury or death, do not smoke and keep fuel away from flames and sparks.

regulation.para: Dispose of fuel according to applicable regulations in a correct container clearly marked DIESEL FUEL.

Engine fluids (oil, fuel, and coolant) may be a threat to the environment. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids and filters according to applicable regulations. Never put engine fluids in the trash, on the ground, in sewers, or bodies of water.

step1.para: Remove fuel strainer cap from fuel filter header.
Remove and discard strainer cap O-ring.
Clean out debris from inside fuel filter header.
Clean seal areas and install a new O-ring on the fuel strainer cap.
Coat fuel strainer cap threads and new O-ring with clean diesel fuel.
Install new or cleaned fuel strainer into fuel filter header.
Tighten fuel strainer cap to special torque .
Start engine and check for fuel leaks. If fuel is leaking turn off engine and repair leaks.
